conclusion: To determine how the shadows (A, B, C, and D) will change when the light source moves to the back left or right, we need to understand the relationship between the light source, the objects, and the shadows they cast.
Shadow A is cast by the object at the top of the image, which appears to be a hand or glove.
Shadow B is cast by the small ring-like object near the center-right.
Shadow C is cast by the bulletin board on the left.
Shadow D is cast by the postcard holder on the right.

When the light source moves: Back Left: The light source will be positioned behind and to the left of the objects. Back Right: The light source will be positioned behind and to the right of the objects.
